column10: MSG
b"b' Add support for the HTTP HEAD method'"
b"b' The servlet container handles HEAD as a bodyless GET for us.  We will need to handle this ourselves for SSGI.'"
b'b" There\'s a lot that needs to be done for SSGI.  We\'ll track those as part of the SSGI project when it is revived."'
b"b' Full support for all HTTP methods'"
b'b\' url OPTIONS: Supported
column11: but could have better default behavior.  Specifically
column12: should look for matching routes of other methods
column13: and return header with all supported methods on request for "*".HEAD: Forwarded to GET
column14: and body discarded by servlet.  Do we have any reason to override?GET: Supported.POST: Supported.PUT: Supported.DELETE: Supported.TRACE: Inherited from servlet spec.  Do we have any reason to override?CONNECT: Not supported.  We should probably add it
column15: though I\\\'m unsure how it would be used in Scalatra.Extension methods: Not supported.  We could allow them
column16: though they wouldn\\\'t have explicit methods in the DSL.\''

column10: b'b\' Great
column11: I understand that all the HTTP verbs are supported by a ScalatraServlet. But I was reffering to the ScalatraTests framework included with Scalatra: The documentation says: "Testing Your Scalatra Applications ... . ScalatraTests supports HTTP  tests with or without request parameters and sessions. For more examples
column12: please refer to ." and that is awesome :)
column13: but I\\\'m just wondering if all the HTTP verbs could be supported here too.\''

column10: b'b" Ah
column11: yes.  We should definitely add the rest.  It\'s actually more important in the tester
column12: because we don\'t get any of them for free like we do in the servlet. We\'re going to be limited to what the Jetty servlet tester supports.  I tried HEAD a while back and ran into a bug
column13: but hopefully that is resolved in a newer Jetty.  We\'ll add whatever the tester can handle. Thanks for the report!"'

Ideally I would want other fields in ApiProperty to work as well (i.e. required) and ApiClass to add descriptions to the models.  The pull request doesn\'t mention them so I\'m assuming those properties aren\'t implemented

column10: b'b" I believe I\'ve figured out the issue. Before
column11: my code looked something like this: None of the info in the ApiProperty was showing up in Swagger. This was due to the way that Scala annotates the parameters to the constructor of the case class (documented [here]url  I was able to make this work by using a type alias as mentioned on that page so that the annotation gets copied to the field: If this works for everyone
column12: it might be nice to get this added to the documentation somewhere."'

b"b' Params and multiParams are empty for PATCH request'"

b"b' There seems to be something wrong with handling PATCH request. According to specification the request parameters could be specified as both query string or payload yet Scalatra only handles the query string ones. By default vast of ajax libraries or other implementations send parameters as request payload. In this case both and are empty but parameters are indeed received and are accessible as url encoded string through  . This is example code: When I send parameter with value print out this both are empty but the I get string. This happens for Scalatra 2.4.0.RC1
